title: Air Arabia Vacancies Open To All Department
description: At Air Arabia, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment where employees truly belong. Our facilities include state-of-the-art office spaces, a gym, gaming facilities, and a multi-cuisine food court. We have a strong corporate social responsibility program, 'Charity Cloud', which supports education and healthcare initiatives globally. We provide career development programs and training opportunities, including the Airline MPL Cadets Pilot Program and certified programs in Flight Dispatch. Fresh graduates in Aeronautical/Aerospace Engineering can join our Engineering & Maintenance team to gain experience.

Motivation to join career development programs

title: Aircraft Maintenance Instructor
description: Working for the British Airways Part-147 training school at Heathrow, you'll be responsible for the development, design, and delivery of aircraft maintenance theory and practical training for British Airways’ apprentices and engineers, as well as external customers. You will carry out training needs analysis, design and update training material, develop lesson plans and deliver training for a selection of Category A & B level Part-66 Modules, Part-66 B1 & B2 Aircraft Type courses, Part-145 and Part-M subjects. You will be working in a highly regulated and safety-conscious environment.
requirements: Experience in developing and delivering aircraft maintenance training in a Part-147 training organization
Part-66 licensed engineers with a passion for teaching
Transferable teaching experience at A-level/HNC or above
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
English language proficiency at B2 level or higher
Team player, culturally aware, and 'can do' attitude
Proficient in Microsoft applications and online meeting/social platforms

companyInfo.description: British Airways is the UK’s national and largest airline, offering many opportunities to develop and further your career.

title: Aircraft Technician
description: The Aircraft Technician is responsible for carrying out maintenance tasks on Emirates and third party aircraft components in accordance with laid down procedures and regulations. The Aircraft Technician will work as part of a team under the direction and guidance of the assigned Licensed Aircraft Engineer within the trade disciplines for which they have been trained. This is a safety-sensitive role involving working at height, exposure to hazardous energy systems, heavy lifting, and working in confined spaces.

Work under the direction of a Licensed Aircraft Engineer
Trained in relevant trade disciplines

title: Aircraft Technician
